paper_title.ja: Change in Ca^<2+> Sensitivity of Cerebrovascular Smooth Muscle in Experimental Chronic Cerebral Vasospasm
paper_title.en: Change in Ca<sup>2+</sup> Sensitivity of Cerebrovascular Smooth muscle in Experimental Chronic Cerebral Vasospasm

description.ja: 脳血管攣縮におけるCa<SUP>2+</SUP>感受性の変化について調べるため、下記の実験を行った。正常犬及び自家血注入法にて作成した犬実験的脳血管攣縮モデルの脳底動脈螺旋標本を用いて、Ca蛍光指示薬fura-2を負荷し、脳血管平滑筋の細胞内Ca濃度([Ca<SUP>2+</SUP><SUB>i</SUB>)と張力変化を同時測定した。収縮薬として、高濃度K<SUP>+</SUP>(72.4mM)、thromboxane A<SUB>2</SUB>(TXA<SUB>2</SUB>)を用い、静止時、収縮時の張力、[Ca<SUP>2+</SUP><SUB>i</SUB>を測定し、1nMの[Ca<SUP>2+</SUP><SUB>i</SUB>の増加に対する血管の単位断面積当たりの張力を計算し、Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>感受性の変化を調べた。攣縮血管では静止時において、血管平滑筋のCa<SUP>2+</SUP>感受性が増加しており、TXA<SUB>2</SUB>が作用するとそのCa<SUP>2+</SUP>感受性がさらに増強することが明らかとなった。
description.en: The mechanism of chronic cerebral vasospasm was investigated by examining the relation between cytosolic Ca<SUP>2+</SUP> level ([Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>]<SUB>i</SUB>) and muscle contraction in vascular smooth muscle after experimental vasospasm produced by the two-hemorrhage method in the canine basilar artery. [Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>]<SUB>i</SUB> and tension were recorded simultaneously with a fluorimeter using the arterial strips with a Ca<SUP>2+</SUP> indicator, fura-2. High K<SUP>+</SUP> concentration (72.4 mM) and U-46619 (thromboxane A<SUB>2</SUB> analogue, 10<SUP>-8</SUP> M) were used as stimulants. The increase in contractile tension per [Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>]<SUB>i</SUB>, per unit cross-sectional area was calculated, and compared for the vasospasm and the control groups. The increase in [Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>]<SUB>i</SUB> in the vasospasm group was smaller than that in the control group, so the increase in tension per [Ca<SUP>2+</SUP>]<SUB>i</SUB> per unit sectional area was larger in the vasospasm group. This value was much larger for the contraction induced by U-46619 than that induced by high K<SUP>+</SUP> concentration in both groups. These results suggest that there is an increase in the basal Ca<SUP>2+</SUP> sensitivity of the contractile elements in vasospastic vessels. In addition, the U46619-induced increase in Ca<SUP>2+</SUP> sensitivity seemed to be augmented in the vasospasm group.

paper_title.ja: 前交通動脈瘤、内頸動脈間吻合、rete carotidisを伴った内頸動脈形成不全症

paper_title.en: Inhibitory effect of diltiazem or nitroglycerin on phorbol ester-induced contraction in cerebrovascular smooth muscle in carine basilar artery

description.en: The inhibitor effect of diltiazem or nitroglycerin (GTN) on the contraction of isolated vascular muscle in canine basilar artery by 12 deoxy- phorbol13-isobutyrate (DPB) was examined. The muscle tension and cytosolic Ca2+ level ([Ca2+]) were recorded simultaneously using a fluorescent Ca2+ indicator, fura 2. Ca2+ free solution was made by removing Ca2+ and adding 0.5 mM EGTA to physiological salt solution (PSS). Contraction was induced by high K+ (72.4 mM) and DBP (10-6M). DPB induced sustained contraction with a transient increase followed by a decrease in →Ca2+]1 below the resting level in PSS. Although [Ca2+]1 decreased below the resting level in Ca2+ free solution, DBP induced transient contraction, the tension of which was similar to that in PSS. These results suggest that DBP increased the sensitivity of contractile elements to C22+. Single administration of diltiazem of GTN inhibited DPB induced contraction only slightly without chaging [Ca2+]1. These results suggest that the increase in Ca2+ sensitivity induced by DBP was too great to be inhibited by the single administration of diltiazem or GTN, or by their combined administration.

paper_title.en: Hypoplasia of the left internal carotid artery associated with anterior communicating aneurysm, intercarotid anastomosis and left rete carotidis

description.en: Hypoplasia of the internal carotid artery with cerebral aneurysm is extremely rare. The authors report a case of hypoplasia of the left internal carotid artery associated with anterior communicating aneurysm, intercarotid anastomosis and left rete carotidis. A 45-year-old man was admitted to Minamata Municipal Hospital because of severe headache and disturbance of consciousness. CT scan showed subarachnoid hemorrhage with intracerebral hematoma. Right carotid angiogram showed the anterior communicating aneurysm arising from the right A1-A2 corner and intercarotid anastomosis on the cavernous portion. The distal part from the C4 portion of the left internal carotid artery was revealed through these anastomotic vessels. Left carotid angiogram showed hypoplasia of the left internal carotid artery and unusual tortuous collateral vessels arising from the left internal maxillary artery, ascending pharyngeal artery and its branches to the left internal carotid artery. These collateral vessels are called "rete carotidis" or "rete mirabile caroticum". Both the intercarotid anastomosis and rete carotidis are unusual anastomotic vessels and are considered not to appear during normal development of the cranial circulation in humans. CT scan with skull base bone target image showed hypoplasia of the left carotid canal. In this case, the change in cranial circulation due to hypoplasia of the internal carotid artery was considered one of the main factors in the development of these unusual anastomotic vessels and cerebral aneurysm.
